snippet: The sentence for Mr. Nagin on 2o corruption counts was less than the recommended range of about 15 to 20 years.
abstract: Former New Orleans Mayor C Ray Nagin is sentenced to 10 years in prison on corruption charges in remarkable fall from grace for man who came to office on anti-corruption pledge; most of crimes he was convicted of were related to kickbacks he took from contractors after Hurricane Katrina.

byline.original: By ALLEN M. JOHNSON Jr. and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON
byline.contributor: Allen M. Johnson Jr. reported from New Orleans, and Campbell Robertson from Jackson, Miss.

lead_paragraph: The sentence for Mr. Nagin on 2o corruption counts was less than the recommended range of about 15 to 20 years.

headline.main: 10-Year Term on Graft Charges for C. Ray Nagin, Former Mayor of New Orleans
headline.print_headline: 10-Year Term on Graft Charges for Ex-Mayor of New Orleans
